metadata.description: Comprehensive playlist mapping: Khan Academy + Brilliant.org lessons to curriculum LOs
sources: Khan Academy (5th Grade CC Math + supplementary 3rd/4th/6th grade and Pre-Algebra)

khan_academy.note: Foundational fractions - covered in KA 3rd/4th grade, not 5th grade CC

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.dw_handout: Fraction Fundamentals: LCM and Comparing fractions

khan_academy.unit_name: 4th Grade - Equivalent fractions and comparing fractions
khan_academy.note: LCM and fraction comparison are 4th grade foundations

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.dw_handout: Fraction Fundamentals: GCF and Simplifying fractions

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.dw_handout: Fraction Fundamentals: Add, Subtract fractions & Multiply fractions

khan_academy.note: Basic fraction operations - bridging from 4th to 5th grade

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT do multi-digit multiplication problems using algorithm (3-digit by 2-digit)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT do multi-digit division problems using algorithm (4-digit by 2 digit)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve simple word problems using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve multi-step word problems using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT mentally estimate results of operations on multi-digit numbers using rounding strategies.
Example: 43 × 13 should be roughly 500 since (43×10)= 430

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT use rounding strategies and inverse operations to verify and cross-check answers to word problems

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT compare and order positive and negative numbers to determine which is greater or less.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT perform simple addition and subtraction problems with negative numbers

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT find every factor pair for numbers 1–100. Eg. For 12, the factor pairs are:
1 × 12 = 12, 2 × 6 = 12, 3 × 4 = 12.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT understand that every whole number is a multiple of its factors. Eg. 12 is a multiple of its factors: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 12.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT determine if a whole number is a multiple of a given one-digit number (Divisibility rules)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT classify a whole number (1–100) as prime or composite.

khan_academy.note: Prime and composite - 4th grade CC standard

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT find LCM of any 2 numbers

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT find HCF of any 2 numbers

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT add and subtract mixed fractions

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT multiply a fraction with whole number and another fraction

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT divide a fraction with a whole number

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT divide a fraction with another fraction

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve word problems involving addition, subtraction, multiplicaiton, division of Fractions using equations and visual models.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT add and Sub decimals upto thousandth place value

khan_academy.note: Addition portion; subtraction covered in Unit 3
Subtraction portion; addition covered in Unit 2

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT multiply decimal numbers with whole numbers
learning_objectives.dw_handout: Deep Work: Decimal Multiplication by whole numbers

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT multiply 2 decimal numbers

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT divide a decimal with a whole number
learning_objectives.dw_handout:
Deep Work: Dividing Decimals by Whole Numbers Part-1
Deep Work: Dividing Decimals by Whole Numbers Part-2
Deep Work: Dividing Decimals by Whole Numbers Part-3

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT divide a decimal with another decimal
learning_objectives.dw_handout: Deep Work: Dividing Decimals by Decimals

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT explain patterns in the number of zeros when multiplying by powers of 10 and in the placement of the decimal point when multiplying or dividing by powers of 10,
(using whole-number exponents to denote powers of 10)."

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve word problems involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, division of Decimals using equations and visual models.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT plot points, lines, and shapes on the coordinate plane (Quadrant 1 --> All Quadrants)

khan_academy.note: KA 5th grade covers Quadrant 1 only; all quadrants is 6th grade

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT understand the relationship between two-dimensional figures and three-dimensional objects.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT identify and classify different categories of triangles and their properties

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT classify quadrilaterals based on properties such as angles, sides, parallel, and perpendicular

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT apply area and perimeter formulas for rectangles and squares to solve real-world and mathematical problems (e.g., finding an unknown width from area).

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve real-world problems involving the area of other two-dimensional figures (Triangles, Parallelograms, composite shapes)  (exception Circles)

khan_academy.unit_name: 6th Grade - Geometry (area of parallelograms, triangles, composite figures)
khan_academy.note: Area of triangles/parallelograms - 6th grade geometry topic

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT read and write simple powers with small exponents and explain them as repeated multiplication.
eg. 3² → “three squared = 3 × 3.” 2³ → “two cubed = 2 × 2 × 2.” 10²= “ten squared= 10 x 10 = 100”

khan_academy.note: Powers of 10 specifically; general exponent concept overlaps

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
eg. Evaluate: 2³ + 5²

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT identify the rule governing number/shape patterns and find the unknowns based on it.
eg. 1, 4, 9, 16, 25 , X

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT use the order of operations to correctly evaluate numerical expressions with parentheses, brackets, and braces.
Expression: 3 × (4 + 2)
“First add 4 + 2 = 6, then 3 × 6 = 18.”

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT represent an unknown number using a letter/symbol.
eg. I am thinking of a number that, when added to 19 gives 40. Can you write an equation?
19 + x = 40.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT write expressions using letters to stand for unknowns from simple word phrases.
eg. Subtract 3 from a number y, then triple the result” → 3(y – 3).

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT distinguish variables and constants in an expression/equation. 
Identify the constant and variable in each:
a. 4x + 7
b. X is the number of tickets bought. Cost of each ticket is 50 Rs. I pay a total cost according to the number of tickets bought.  T = 50X

khan_academy.note: Variables vs constants - 6th grade algebra topic

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT use properties of operations (distributive, commutative, associative) to rewrite expressions in equivalent forms.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT solve an equation to find an unknown (methods: substitution, adding/subtracting on both sides, multiplying/dividing on both sides, etc)
1. 3x = 12
Try x = 4 → 3×4 = 12 (true).
Try x = 5 → 3×5 = 15 (not true).
So x = 4 is a solution
2. 2x + 7 = 10
2x= 3 (subtracting 7 from both sides)
x= 3/2  (dividing by 2 on both sides)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT solve word problems and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q (with non-negative rational numbers).
eg. A pen and a notebook together cost ₹120. The pen costs ₹45. How much is the notebook?”
Equation: 45 + n = 120 → n = 120 – 45 = 75.

khan_academy.note: Equation word problems - 6th grade equations topic

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT represent two changing quantities with variables, write an equation connecting them, and analyze the relationship using tables and graphs.
eg. A taxi charges a fixed ₹50 + ₹20 per km. Can you plot fare vs distance?
Variables: d = distance (km), C = total cost (₹).
Equation: C = 20d + 50.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT solve word problems involving unit rates (eg. unit pricing, constant speed, work done per hr)
Unit pricing: $18 for 3 pounds apples → $6 per pound; which is better, $6/lb or $25 for 5 lb?
Speed: 240 km in 3 hours → 80 km per hour; at that rate, distance in 5 hours = 80×5=400km

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT understand a percent as a rate per 100 and as a fraction and decimal.
eg. 25% means 25 out of 100, so 25%=25/100=1/4=0.25

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT convert a number from fraction to percent and decimal, and vice versa.
eg. 3/5=0.6=60%
0.08=8%

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT Find a given percent of a number, using models or equations.
eg. Find  30% of 50
A class of 40 students: 25% are absent, how many are absent

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT given two quantities, find what percent one is of the other.
eg. What percent of 80 is 20?
20/80=0.25=25%
A student scores 18 out of 24. How much % did he score?
18/24=0.75=75%

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective:
SWBAT solve real-world problems involving percent increase, decrease, discounts, tips, and taxes.
eg. Discount: A shirt costs $200 with 20% off. How much is the final cost?
Increase: A population grows from 1,000 to 1,200. How much % has it grown?

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT read and interpret a line graph

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT plot a line graph

khan_academy.note: Line plots vs line graphs differ; closest KA match at 5th grade level

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Identify common angles like 30, 45, 60, 90,  right, acute, and obtuse.

khan_academy.note: Angle identification and types - 4th grade geometry topic

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT measure and sketch angles with protractor

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT calculate complementary and supplementary angles.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve word problems involving angles

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT identify and classify triangles (Right, isoceles, equilateral)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT identify and differentiate common 2D figures by angles, side-lengths, parallel lines.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT recognize lines of symmetry in 2D figures.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT read and write multi-digit numbers in standard, word, and expanded form.

khan_academy.note: Place value basics - 4th grade place value topic

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT explain that each digit is 10× the value of the digit to its right and 1/10 of the digit to its left.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Add and Subtract multi-digit numbers using algo

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT do efficient Add & Sub by using properties like: commutative, associative, breaking nos, multiples of 10, Counting up/down etc.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT multiply up to 4-digit × 1-digit using algo, area model, etc.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT to do efficient multiplication by using properties like: doubling, skip counting, associative, distributive

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT divide up to 4-digit ÷ 1-digit, finding quotients and remainders using place value.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Multi-step word problem of add/sub/mul/div, using equations with Unknowns.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT multiply two 2-digit numbers using place-value, and algo method.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT use BODMAS/PEDMAS to do order of operations.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT verify calculations using inverse operations (mul ↔ div; add ↔ sub)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Verify calculation using estimation and rounding.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT relate fractions to real objects: (x/y means y “equal” pieces and then take x out of it.)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT mark fractions on a number line.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT compare fractions using models and the number line.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT find equivalent fraction of a given fraction.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Add and Subtract like fractions.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Multiply a fraction by a whole number and another fraction.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Simplify a given fraction.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Convert mixed to improper fraction

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Convert improper to mixed fraction.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Compare unlike fractions

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT express a fraction (a/b, where a > 1) as a sum of unit fractions (1/b).

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Add and Sub unlike fractions

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT Add and Sub mixed fractions

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve word problems involving add and sub of fractions (Unlike and mixed)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT convert common units (km–m–cm; kg–g; l–ml; hr–min–sec)

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve real-world problems about distance, time, volume, mass, and money.

khan_academy.note: Broad measurement word problems - spans multiple units and grade levels

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT calculate area for rectangles and composite rectangles

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT calculate perimeter for triangles, rectangles, and composite shapes

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve word problesm involving area and perimeter of rectangles.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT understand and calculate volume of cube and rectangular prism.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT compute the surface area of rectangular prism/composite figures

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve word problems of surface area and volume.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT plot points, Lines, and shapes on the coordinate plane.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve problems, like distances between 2 points their midpoints.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT interpret and plot data in various graphs.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT show decimals up to hundredth place on a number line.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT compare and order decimals upto hundredths place

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT convert fractions with denominator 100 to decimals and vice versa

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT convert fractions to decimal notation.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT add a decimal with whole no. and another decimal.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT sub a decimal with whole no. and another decimal.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT multiply a decimal with whole no.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT divide 2 whole numbers to get a decimal quotient.

learning_objectives.subject: Math
learning_objectives.learning_objective: SWBAT solve multi-digit computation problems that too word problems involving decimals.
